CiteProc::Selector

Public Class Methods

new(argument = {}) click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 9
def initialize(argument = {})
  key_filter['all'] = 'select'
  key_filter['any'] = 'include'
  key_filter['none'] = 'exclude'
  key_filter['skip'] = 'quash'
  
  merge(normalize(argument))
end

Public Instance Methods

conditions() click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 27
def conditions
  attributes[type] || []
end
matcher() click to toggle source

@returns one of :all?, :any?, :none?

# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 23
def matcher
  type == 'include' ? :any? : type == 'exclude' ? :none? : :all?
end
matches?(item) click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 31
def matches?(item)
  conditions.send(matcher) { |condition| match(item, condition) }
end
skip?(item) click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 35
def skip?(item)
  has_quash? && quash.all? { |condition| match(item, condition) }
end
to_proc() click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 39
def to_proc
  Proc.new { |item| matches?(item) && !skip?(item) }
end
type() click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 18
def type
  attributes.keys.detect { |k| [:select, :include, :exclude].include?(k.to_sym) }
end

Protected Instance Methods

match(item, condition) click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 45
def match(item, condition)
  values, expected = [item[condition['field']]].flatten.map(&:to_s), [condition['value']].flatten
  expected & values != []
end
normalize(argument) click to toggle source 
# File lib/citeproc/selector.rb, line 50
def normalize(argument)
  case
  when [String, Symbol].include?(argument.class) && !(argument.to_s =~ /^\s*\{/)
    { argument.to_s => [] }
  else
    argument
  end
end
